newsitem.title: UK: NWE mogas steadies as IOC tenders, awaits US lead.
newsitem.headline: NWE mogas steadies as IOC tenders, awaits US lead.

text.p: NWE gasoline was broadly steady on Friday after yesterday's climb in a market that was seen to be drifting sideways.
"We are really waiting for the U.S. to kick in," said one dealer.
NYMEX June unleaded futures last traded on ACCESS 0.38 cent lower at 57.50 cents a gallon.
A couple of Eurograde barges were sold at $212 fob ARA, but levels eased back towards $209-211 by mid-morning. A June swap was concluded at $209.75.
State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) re-emerged in the spot market to buy leaded gasoline for June and to buy test cargoes of unleaded gasoline for July to October through two tenders.

The company has issued the first tender, which closes on May 28, to buy 25,000 tonnes of 87 octane for June 10-14 delivery. The second tender is for 16 kilolitres on unleaded gasoline for delivery in July and 32 kilolitres for delivery each in August, September and October.
